title: DSA Level 3 — Strings & Basic Hashing
concept: Classic string operations: frequency, palindromes, anagrams, sliding window on strings.

challenges.title: Check Palindrome String
challenges.description: Given a string S, determine if it is a palindrome (reads the same forwards and backwards). Print "YES" or "NO".

challenges.title: Count Character Frequency
challenges.description: Given a string S consisting of lowercase English letters, count the frequency of each character and print them in increasing order of character.
challenges.outputDescription: For each character c that appears in S, print a line: c count.

challenges.title: Anagram Check
challenges.description: Given two strings A and B, check if they are anagrams of each other (contain the same characters with the same frequencies). Print "YES" or "NO".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: string A. Second line: string B.
challenges.outputDescription: "YES" if A and B are anagrams, otherwise "NO".

challenges.title: First Non-Repeating Character
challenges.description: Given a string S, find the first character that does not repeat anywhere in the string. If it exists, print that character. Otherwise, print -1.

challenges.title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
challenges.description: Given a string S, find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters.

challenges.title: Count Vowels and Consonants
challenges.description: Given a lowercase English string S, count how many characters are vowels and how many are consonants.
challenges.inputDescription: Single line: string S made of 'a'-'z'.

challenges.title: Rotate String by K
challenges.description: Given a string S and an integer K, perform a left rotation of the string by K positions (cyclic). Print the rotated string.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: string S. Second line: integer K.

challenges.title: Check Subsequence
challenges.description: Given two strings S and T, check if S is a subsequence of T. Print "YES" or "NO".
challenges.inputDescription: First line: S. Second line: T.
challenges.outputDescription: "YES" if S is a subsequence of T, else "NO".

challenges.title: Longest Common Prefix of Strings
challenges.description: Given N strings, find the longest common prefix of all strings. If no common prefix exists, print an empty string.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: N. Next N lines: each a string.
challenges.outputDescription: Single line: longest common prefix (possibly empty).
examples:
Input:
3
flower
flow
flight

Output:
fl
challenges.constraints: 1 ≤ N ≤ 10^5, total length of all strings ≤ 10^5

challenges.title: Smallest Window Containing All Characters
challenges.description: You are given two strings S and P. Find the length of the smallest substring of S that contains all characters of P (with their required frequencies). If no such window exists, print -1.
challenges.inputDescription: First line: S. Second line: P.
challenges.outputDescription: Single integer: length of smallest window, or -1.
